newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Hong Kong to study pay TV market deregulation.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong to study pay TV market deregulation.

text.p: The Hong Kong government said on Monday it was reviewing deregulation of the pay television market and may issue more licences after the study.

"A particular focus of the review will be the scope for deregulating the pay TV market and I hope it will be possible to issue more pay TV and programme service licences after that," said Brian Chau, Secreatry for Broadcasting, Culture and Sport.
Chau also told a business luncheon that Hong Kong could be the first to have video-on-demand service on a commerical scale.

"Already, several companies have expressed interest in offering such services. That is why Hong Kong is set to be the first place in the world to see a commerical-scale roll-out of video-on-demand services," he said.
The government's study, which will be carried out over the next few months, would also look at ways on how to maintain Hong Kong's as the media hub in the Asia region, he said.
